item.title: [HBASE-8176] Backport HBASE-5335 "Dynamic Schema Configurations" to 0.94
item.description:
With HBASE-5335, we can support per-table configuration and per-family configurations.

We can use it to customize the compaction on table/family basis, customize the flush, and etc..

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I expect we'll have an "interesting" discussion here on whether this is safe to backport or not

IMHO, 0.96 will not be so far from now... And HBASE-5335 is already in. Also, it's a pretty big patch. So I'm not sure it worst the backport. But on the other side, it's not breaking any compatibility, so it might not be an issue to backport it. If you want my non-commiter opinion I will say I'm +0 on it.
Personally I am also a bit concerned on this back port. So +0 from my side as well.

Lars, Jean-Marc, and Anoop, thank you for the comments, they make sense. On the other side, I do find it valuable for those who want to keep 0.94 in production for a long time, considering the big changes in 0.96 and risks of upgrading.

I will attach my patch him, so that those who want this feature can patch it directly.

Thanks
add HBASE-5335 patch for 0.94

Looking at the patch again, it doesn't look so bad.
It's not immediately clear from the patch... Does not change the HBase shell syntax? If so, we'd need to remedy that.

Did you run the full 0.94 test suite? Is this running (and used) in a real cluster somewhere?

Lars, it did modify the shell admin.rb and hbase.rb. In shell, it introduced a compound config named as "CONFIG". And all additional configurations are configured under "CONFIG", such as CONFIG=>

{conf1=>'', conf2=>''}

I did another internal patch(not this one) for 0.94.1, and used it in production for months.

This patch has minor difference compared with 0.94.2, I only tested the UT part, will try to run full 0.94 test suite.
All UT and all integration tests pass.

On the other side, I do find it valuable for those who want to keep 0.94 in production for a long time, considering the big changes in 0.96 and risks of upgrading.

There is value in having CompoundConfiguration in 0.94 because it allows for finer grained compaction policy.

The patch looks reasonable. At first glance I have mostly some concerns about the shell changes.

  • It looks like they are backwards compatible. Is that true?
  • Could you add to the site documentation or the shell's help text somewhere an example of how to change compaction policy using CONFIG? What does this look like? How easy is it to type it in?

Came here again to say the same, Andy
If the shell's help text would describe this, that'd be great.

+1 if we do the following:

  1. add to shell help text
  2. add release notes to this jira describing the syntax
  3. run the full 0.94 test suite.

Thanks for hanging in here Sean Zhong.

I got:

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestShell
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 38.334 sec <<< FAILURE!

@Ted, thanks for pointting out the test error, I made a mistake, I neglected the largeTest category test. Now, all UT and integration test passes.

@Andrew, the shell syntax is completely compatible with before, it extends the function by adding a new attribute "CONFIG", while old attributes still works.

@Lars and Andrew,
I have updated the HBase shell context help in the patch:

or a shorter version:

hbase> alter 't1', 'delete' => 'f1'
+
+You can also change the column family config by set attribute CONFIG like this:
+ hbase> alter 'test', NAME=>'f', CONFIG =>

Unknown macro: {'hbase.hstore.compaction.min' => '5'}

You can also change table-scope attributes like MAX_FILESIZE
MEMSTORE_FLUSHSIZE, READONLY, and DEFERRED_LOG_FLUSH.
@@ -47,6 +50,9 @@
For example, to change the max size of a family to 128MB, do:

hbase> alter 't1', METHOD => 'table_att', MAX_FILESIZE => '134217728'
+
+You can also change the table-scope by set attribute CONFIG like this:
+ hbase> alter 'test', METHOD=>'table_att', CONFIG =>

Here is the suggested release notes for this patch:

Release notes:
With HBASE-8176("Dynamic Schema Configurations"), we can define table/column family specific configuration by HColumnDescriptor.setValue() or HTableDescriptor.setValue().
We can also do this easily in hbase shell, like this:
Change the table-scope by set attribute CONFIG like this:
alter 'test', METHOD => 'table_att', CONFIG =>

Unknown macro: {'hbase.hstore.compaction.min' => '5'}

Change the column family config by set attribute CONFIG like this:a
alter 'test', NAME => 'f', CONFIG =>

Unknown macro: {'hbase.hstore.compaction.min' => a'5'}

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
With HBASE-8176("Dynamic Schema Configurations"), we can define table/column family specific configuration by HColumnDescriptor.setValue() or HTableDescriptor.setValue(). We can also do this easily in hbase shell.

Change the table-scope by set attribute CONFIG like this:
alter 'test', METHOD => 'table_att', CONFIG => {'hbase.hstore.compaction.min' => '5'}

Change the column family config by set attribute CONFIG like this:
alter 'test', NAME => 'f', CONFIG => {'hbase.hstore.compaction.min' => '5'}
